item.title: Handling logs and errors in Haskell
item.description: Abstract Handling logs and errors in pure and stateless programs is difficult, if we want to do it simultaneously it’s even harder, however with knowledge of some monads, and monad transformers can be done. I assume that you are familiar with Maybe monad, Writer monad, and Monoid concept. If not You can read about them here: Maybe - Haskell/Understanding monads/Maybe Writer - Writer monad Monoid - Monoid MyLogger My goal is to create data structure that can aggregate logs, and allow for calculation to fail.

item.title: Extensible IRC Bot in Haskell
